      • changeDepartment

        public void changeDepartment(java.lang.String eid,
                             java.lang.Integer did)
                      throws IdNotFoundException
        Change the department of employee with id 'eid' to a new department with id 'did'. You can assume that 'did' denotes a department different from the current department of the employee denoted by 'eid'.
        Parameters:
        eid - id of some employee
        did - id of some department
        Throws:
        IdNotFoundException - if either eid is a non-existing employee id or did is a non-existing department id.

      • getEmployeeName

        public java.lang.String getEmployeeName(java.lang.String id)
                                 throws IdNotFoundException
        Retrieve the name of employee with id 'id'.
        Parameters:
        id - id of some employee
        Returns:
        name of the employee with id 'id'
        Throws:
        IdNotFoundException - if 'id' is not an existing employee id

      • getEmployeeNames

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getEmployeeNames(java.lang.Integer id)
        Retrieve the names of all employees of the department with id 'id'. If 'id' a non-existing department id, then return an empty list.
        Parameters:
        id - id of some department
        Returns:
        List of names of employees whose home department has id 'id'

      • getDepartmentInfo

        public DepartmentInfo getDepartmentInfo(java.lang.String id)
                                 throws IdNotFoundException
        Retrieve an employee's department's information object.
        Parameters:
        id - id of some existing employee
        Returns:
        The information object of the employee's home department
        Throws:
        IdNotFoundException - if 'id' is not an existing employee id

      • getSortedEmployeeInfo

        public EmployeeInfo[] getSortedEmployeeInfo()
        Retrieve a list, sorted in increasing order, the information objects of all stored employees. Hints: 1. Override the 'comareTo' method in EmployeeInfo class. 2. Look up the Arrays.sort method in Java API.
        Returns:
        A sorted list of information objects of all employees.

      • getAverageSalary

        public double getAverageSalary(java.lang.Integer id)
                        throws IdNotFoundException
        Retrieve the average salary of all employees in department with id 'id'.
        Parameters:
        id - id of some department
        Returns:
        average salary of all employees in department with id 'id'
        Throws:
        IdNotFoundException - if id is not an existing department id

      • getDepartmentOfHighestAverageSalary

        public DepartmentInfo getDepartmentOfHighestAverageSalary()
        Retrieve the information object of the department with the highest average salary among its employees.
        Returns:
        the information object of the department with the highest average salary among its employees Hint: Use 'getAverageSalary(Integer id)' as a helper method.
